latestVersion.specialPermissions: Additional special permissions, where applicable, are described in the restrictions field.
latestVersion.restrictions: Individual identifiers have been removed from the microdata tapes available from the National Center for Health Statistics. Nevertheless, under section 308(d) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 242m), data collected by the National Center for Health Statistics may not be used for any purpose other than for statistical reporting. ICPSR recommends to users that individual elementary unit data contained in this collection be used solely for statistical research.
latestVersion.conditions: AVAILABLE. This study is freely available to the general public.
latestVersion.disclaimer: The original collector of the data, ICPSR, 		and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility 		for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences 		based upon such uses.

fields.value: National Health Interview Survey, 1979:  Eye Care Supplement

authorName.value: United States Department of Health and Human Services. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. National Center for Health Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Health and Human Services. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. National Center for Health Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: The basic purpose of the Health Interview Survey (HIS) is to obtain information about the amount and distribution of illness, its effects in terms of disability and chronic impairments, and the kinds of health services people receive. The Eye Care Supplement file provides variables from the core Person file (see NATIONAL HEALTH INTERVIEW SURVEY, 1979 [ICPSR 8049]) including sex, age, race, marital status, veteran status, education, income, industry and occupation codes, and limits on activity. The variables unique to this Eye Care Supplement include information on eye care in the past 12 months, kind of doctor/specialist, place of visit, and date of last visit.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR IX. Health Care and Health Facilities
NACDA V. Physical Health and Functioning of Older Adults

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Civilian, noninstitutionalized population of the United States and the District of Columbia from 1,924 geographically defined Primary Sampling Units (PSUs).

fields.value: A multistage probability sample was used in selecting housing units.

These data contain multiple weight variables for each part. Users should refer to the User Guide for further information regarding the weights and their derivation. Additionally, users may need to weight the data prior to analysis.
Created online analysis version with question text.
